alert.note: Alert for Codington; Deuel; Hamlin (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued March 30 at 1:43PM MDT until March 31 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM CDT FRIDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Ice Storm Warning, significant icing expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to one third of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Codington, Hamlin and Deuel Counties. * WHEN...For the Ice Storm Warning, from 1 AM to 4 PM CDT Friday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 4 PM Friday to 7 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The timing of the transition is still uncertain, so headlines may need to be adjusted by a few hours either way.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
